notes.text:
An update for vim is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Vim (Vi IMproved) is an updated and improved version of the vi editor.

Security Fix(es):

* vim: heap-based buffer overflow in win_redr_status() in drawscreen.c (CVE-2021-3872)

* vim: illegal memory access in find_start_brace() in cindent.c when C-indenting (CVE-2021-3984)

* vim: heap-based buffer overflow in find_help_tags() in help.c (CVE-2021-4019)

* vim: use-after-free in win_linetabsize() (CVE-2021-4192)

* vim: out-of-bound read in getvcol() (CVE-2021-4193)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: An out-of-bounds write flaw was found in vim's drawscreen.c win_redr_status() function. This flaw allows an attacker to trick a user to open a crafted file with specific arguments in vim, triggering an out-of-bounds write. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, and system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: vim: heap-based buffer overflow in win_redr_status() in drawscreen.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw is out of support scope for vim as shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7. For more comprehensive information about Red Hat Enterprise Linux support scope, please see https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Since this flaw requires user interaction, mitigation is to not open files from untrusted sources using vim.

vulnerabilities.title: vim: heap-based buffer overflow in win_redr_status() in drawscreen.c

notes.text: A flaw was found in vim. A possible heap-based buffer overflow allows an attacker to input a specially crafted file, leading to a crash or code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is confidentiality, integrity, and system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: vim: illegal memory access in find_start_brace() in cindent.c when C-indenting
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Do not run untrusted vim scripts with -s {scriptin} as it is never safe to do so.

vulnerabilities.title: vim: illegal memory access in find_start_brace() in cindent.c when C-indenting

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: A flaw was found in vim. A possible heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability allows an attacker to input a specially crafted file, leading to a crash or code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: vim: heap-based buffer overflow in find_help_tags() in help.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Do not run untrusted vim scripts with -s {scriptin} as it is never safe to do so.

vulnerabilities.title: vim: heap-based buffer overflow in find_help_tags() in help.c

notes.text: It was found that vim was vulnerable to use-after-free flaw in win_linetabsize(). Sourcing a specially crafted file in vim could crash the vim process or possibly lead to other undefined behaviors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

notes.text: It was found that vim was vulnerable to an out-of-bound read flaw in getvcol(). A specially crafted file could be used to, when opened in vim, disclose some of the process's internal memory.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
